entries.meaning: The ratio of the probability of an event happening to that of it not happening.
examples: I'd say the odds are strongly in favor of the sun rising tomorrow morning.

entries.meaning: The ratio of winnings to stake in betting situations.
(chess) An advantage given to a weaker opponent in order to equalize the game when playing casually, usually by removing one of the stronger player's pieces or by giving the weaker player more time.
examples: She beat me with knight odds but lost with rook odds.
The grandmaster gave his opponents significant time odds, of one minute versus ten minutes.
